result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Wayne Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Ex parte communication (letter) from Defendant was sent to Judge's office from Clerk of Court's office - Letter was not given to Judge.  Defendant called and was advised to contact his attorney.

Defendant Matthew Wayne Taylor in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Advised of his rights.  Defendant entered plea of no contest to misd. battery. State moved to delete enhancer.   Court grants motion to amend to misd. battery only enhancer is deleted.   Court finds defendant guilty 940.19(1) and count 2 is dismissed and used as a read-in.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs $768.00 - 45 days county jail to report by 2/5/16 by 3:00 pm with huber
     No contact with Forest Gokey - undergo counseling DOC may recommend -$500.00 bond to be applied towards fine/costs by DOC

Defendant Matthew Wayne Taylor in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have an agreement.  Atty McLaughlin requests adjournment for Plea/sentencing to get Defendant's employment matters resolved.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
